meanings.definition: Silence or quietness, especially as a result of someone's request.
meanings.sent1: The hush in the library was so peaceful.
meanings.sent2: The hush of the forest at night was calming.
meanings.sent3: The sudden hush in the classroom made everyone look up.
meanings.sent4: The hush of the falling snow blanketed the city.
meanings.sent5: The hush of the audience before the performance was electric.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something quiet or silent.
meanings.sent1: She tried to hush the barking dog with a treat.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to hush during the test.
meanings.sent3: He gently hushed the crying baby to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The wind hushed the rustling leaves in the trees.
meanings.sent5: The mother hushed her child's fears with a comforting hug.

meanings.definition: A command or gesture for someone to be quiet.
meanings.sent1: The teacher gave a quick hush to the chatty students.
meanings.sent2: The librarian's hush signaled the start of storytime.
meanings.sent3: The parent's hush with a finger to the lips stopped the argument.
meanings.sent4: The conductor's hush quieted the orchestra before the performance.
meanings.sent5: The boss's hush in the meeting room silenced all discussions.
